attributes.action: get rid of the BMI/weight criteria and the menstruation criteria in the diagnosis of anorexia nervosa
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
to be diagnosed with anorexia nervosa you must have a BMI [body mass index] of 17.5 or less.
many people have all the behaviours and thought patterns of anorexia nervosa, but have a BMI over 17.5
this means they can't be diagnosed with anorexia nervosa.
weight should not be an issue.
most anorexics start off in the "healthy" or even the overweight category of weight.
they ruin thier body just as much as someone who is very underweight.

to be diagnosed with anorexia nervosa you must have also missed at least 3 menstruations [periods] in a row.
*not for men of course*
this criteria is irrelivant when it comes to the diagnosis of anorexia nervosa.
many girls/woman continue to menstrate even though thier BMI is very low.
it's also possible that some girls/women have irregular menstration cycles due to anorexia nervosa, this means they can't be diagnosed with anorexia nervosa.
just because a girl/women has periods it should not affect the diagnosis.

if people are not diagnosed with the correct eating disorder how can you expect them to get the right treatment!
these people are often seen as "not seriously ill", yet they need just as much help as anorexia or bulimia.
